overview: Hosea's marriage to an unfaithful wife pictures God's relationship with unfaithful Israel. Despite their spiritual adultery, God's love pursues His people and promises restoration.

verses.text: For I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice, the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.
I will heal their apostasy; I will love them freely, for my anger has turned from them.
And I will betroth you to me forever. I will betroth you to me in righteousness and in justice, in steadfast love and in mercy. I will betroth you to me in faithfulness. And you shall know the LORD.

passages.title: Hosea's Marriage
passages.summary: God commands Hosea to marry an unfaithful woman, symbolizing His love for unfaithful Israel. Hosea redeems her from slavery.

facts.text: Hosea's name means 'salvation'â€”the same root as Joshua and Jesus.
Jesus quoted Hosea 6:6 twice, emphasizing mercy over ritual (Matthew 9:13, 12:7).
Hosea prophesied to the northern kingdom of Israel during its final prosperous years before Assyrian conquest.

figures.name: Hosea
figures.description: A prophet whose painful marriage became a living parable of God's relentless love for His unfaithful people.

figures.name: Gomer
figures.description: Hosea's unfaithful wife, representing Israel's spiritual adultery. Hosea redeems her, showing God's pursuing love.

videos.title: Hosea Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores how Hosea's marriage depicts God's faithful love.
